We evaluate the influence of applying a Fourier transform, where the transform is defined as \\( F(\\omega) = \\int_{-\\infty}^\\infty z(t) e^{-i\\omega t} dt \\).

Knowing the Fourier transform \\( F(\\omega) \\) for all frequencies \\( \\omega \\), can we determine whether an intervention altering \\( k \\) to \\( k' \\) took place, and exactly when it happened?

The transform aggregates all time-domain information into the frequency domain, losing specific temporal markers necessary to identify the timing and nature of interventions.
